name: Blackjack
description: The unlicensed Blackjack plays just like the ‘American Blackjack’ rules found in the casino compete with all the things you expect to find like split, double down (named as double, used with restrictions), surrender (named as ‘give up’, not used in most real casinos) and insurance (named as insure) as well as the push and charlie rules. Before starting the game, the player can select things like starting money, table limit, and the number of decks used as well as changing the color and design of the cards. Two-player mode is also available with both players taking turns with ether one or two controllers.

shot.caption: Rule changes screen where the player can select the Number of Decks Used, Table Limit, and the Starting Cash as well as the Two-Player options.
Preferences screen where the player changes the card design as well as sound.
The starting table, from here the player can change the bet amount and deal.
A game in progress, I have dealt a 16.
When the dealer deals an Ace, the player has the option of Insurance.
The dealer collects the insurance. This happens if you have payed it or not.
Five cards under 21 is a Charlie and automatically wins unless the dealer also has a Charlie, then it is a push (take the original bet back).
I was dealt a Blackjack (two cards totalling 21) so I instantly win (unless the dealer also has a blackjack then it’s a push).
Playing a split. When two equal cards are dealt (in this case two 3’s) the player has the option of spiting the two cards into two different games.
Playing the game in two-player mode. It taken in turns regardless of if one or two controllers are used.
